Reviews.Title: Great Performer
Reviews.Author: Pei-Ling Roerig
Reviews.Content: This was nearly the perfect laptop for me- a backlit keyboard would have capped it for me. It is blistering fast, lightweight and compact for someone who travels for a living and has amazing battery life with the 4th gen chip and the ssd. I also have the 128GB drive, found a good deal at Micro Center for $799. One comment - the plastic bezel around the top of the keyboard doesn't seat well and is and looks a little wavy, but not bad enough to warrant a return

Reviews.Title: Basically a supercharged netbook
Reviews.Author: Vance Hanson
Reviews.Content: I used to have a $300 Acer Aspire One with a Celeron 877, and this Dell reminds me much of that Acer. The thing is, however, that the Acer is a netbook and this is an ultrabook. Intel should have excluded LED backlighting from the Ultrabook requirements.Such a powerfull ans seemingly good laptop ruined by this grainy, backlit, barely HD display. Oh well, at least it moves at the blink of an eye. Oh, and I have the 128GB SSD version.
